name: InboundOrder
description: Contains inforamation about inbound orders into your companies locations. For example, for example, purchase orders (POs), blanket POs, production orders, or stock transfer orders).

fields.name: id
fields.description: Referred by other objects as 'order_id' unless explicitly stated

fields.name: connection_id
fields.description: Unique identifier for the data source (i.e. connection). Auto populated by ASC.

fields.name: order_type
fields.description:
Type of order. E.g. BlanketPO, ReplenishmentPO, StockTransfer, LongTermBuy (has no product), ProductionOrder

'Reserved' values for ASC 2022: 
â€œPO": Purchase Order
"TO": Transfer Order
"BO": Blanket Order
"CO": Consumption Order
"PR": Purchase Requisition
"RFQ": Request for Quote
"": Null is also acceptable; 

Usage is determined by apps and customers
Customers can also populate their own values.

Notes on specific order types: 
consumption_order: a type of order that will be used to consume raw material in order to produce finished goods. Given ASC does not support MRP, these will be provided by customer and be used by ASC Inventory Projection to reduce inventory
production_order: a type of order that represents finished goods produced, after consumption of raw material. These goods appear at the site

fields.name: order_status
fields.description:
Status of the order. E.g. Planned (not send to vendor), Submitted (sent to vendor), Confirmed, Complete

'Reserved' values for ASC 2022: 
"Cancelled" 
"Open" 
"Closed" 
"InTransit" 
"Confirmed" 
"": Null is also acceptable; 
Usage is determined by apps and customers
Customers can also populate their own values.

fields.name: to_site_id
fields.description: Site into which order will arrive.

fields.name: tpartner_id
fields.description: Partner to which order is sent. E.g. for PO, this will be vendors

fields.name: order_currency_uom
fields.description: Currency UOM for Company

fields.name: vendor_currency_uom
fields.description: Currency UOM of vendor

fields.name: exchange_rate
fields.description: Exchange rate used for conversion

fields.name: exchange_rate_date
fields.description: Date and time when exchange rate was calculate

fields.name: incoterm
fields.description: 3 letter incoterm code

fields.name: incoterm2
fields.description: Place of ownership transfer

fields.name: incoterm_location_1
fields.description: Incoterm location 1. Can be a site_id or the location used on order/EDI

fields.name: incoterm_location_2
fields.description: Incoterm location 2. Can be a site_id or the location used on order/EDI

fields.name: submitted_date
fields.description: Date and time when order was submitted to vendor

fields.name: agreement_start_date
fields.description: If PO is associated with contract or agreement, then start datetime of contract

fields.name: agreement_end_date
fields.description: If PO is associated with contract  or agreement, then end datetime of contract

fields.name: shipping_instr_code
fields.description: Code for shipping instructions.

fields.name: payment_terms_code
fields.description: Code for payment terms

fields.name: std_terms_agreement
fields.description: Agreement between company and vendor

fields.name: std_terms_agreement_ver
fields.description: Version of agreement between company and vendor

fields.name: agreement_number
fields.description: Number associated with contract or agreement

fields.name: inbound_order_url
fields.description: URL to access inbound order record in source system

fields.name: source
fields.description: Source of data

fields.name: db_creation_dttm
fields.description: Internal audit field - stores when the record was created

fields.name: db_updation_dttm
fields.description: Internal audit field - stores when the record was last updated

fields.name: source_update_dttm
fields.description: Date time stamp of the update made in the source system (SAP etc).

fields.name: source_event_id
fields.description: ID of the event created in the source system. Example: PO Receipt, Shipment schedule etc
